revised_title: Empirical Laws of Tides in Liverpool: A Comparative Study
tldr: The author, William Whewell, analyzes 16 years of tide observations from Liverpool and compares them to previous findings from London. He improves the mathematical formulas representing tidal inequalities and verifies the general form of corrections for lunar parallax and declination. Whewell suggests a simple theory of tides based on equilibrium positions and introduces the concept of retroposition in longitude and time. The study's findings can be applied to understanding tides at other locations.
